Kenyatta National Hospital's Oncology Centre, providing national-level cancer diagnosis and specialized care.

Dr. Grace Wanjiku’s role as Consultant Oncologist at Kenyatta National Hospital

A structured CarePlan profile for oncology management in Kenya. Aligns with the Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Cancer Policy (2020–2030), KEMRI and County Cancer Registries. Supports multidisciplinary cancer care coordination, treatment protocols, and reporting using ICD-10 exclusively.

name.value: Oncology Diagnostic Report - Biopsy for Cervical Cancer

description.value: Pathology report for cervical biopsy indicating squamous cell carcinoma

FHIR R4-based profile for diagnostic reports in oncology within the Kenyan healthcare context. Supports pathology, radiology, laboratory, and imaging reports aligned with: - Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027) - Kenya Cancer Policy (2020–2030) - KEMRI cancer registries - UHC and SHA reporting - National staging and reporting standards - County-based registry efforts (e.g., Nyandarua)

A profile for documenting oncology-related patient encounters in Kenya, aligned with the Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Kenya Cancer Policy (2020–2030), KEMRI registry data needs, and county-level cancer reporting workflows. Supports tracking of staging visits, diagnosis, treatment initiation, follow-ups, referrals, and palliative care within the Kenyan oncology ecosystem.

This Implementation Guide demonstrates how HL7® FHIR® can be leveraged to enhance oncology care in Kenya. It includes standardized profiles such as OncologyKenyaPatient and OncologyObservationKenya, tailored search parameters, and extensions reflecting Kenya's SHA and health system realities.
It is developed independently by a Kenyan health tech enthusiast to stimulate innovation, interoperability, and alignment with national cancer priorities.

A FHIR R4-based Claim profile tailored for cancer-related health financing in Kenya. Supports SHA (Social Health Authority) reimbursement workflows and aligns with: - Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy 2023–2027, - Kenya Cancer Policy 2020–2030, - KEMRI cancer reporting and financing infrastructure.
A Condition profile for structured oncology diagnosis documentation in Kenya, aligned with national cancer registry reporting and HL7® FHIR® standards.
Defines insurance and reimbursement details under SHA in Kenya, ensuring financial tracking and integration with NCCP Data Systems.
Defines pathology and laboratory reports for oncology patients in Kenya, integrating with DHIS2 and cancer registries.

name.value: Oncology Kenya FHIR Server Capability Statement

description.value: Defines the capabilities of the Oncology Implementation Guide for Kenya conforming to national cancer care standards.

FHIR Location profile tailored for cancer care delivery points in Kenya. Supports capture of facilities relevant to cancer diagnosis, treatment, and palliative care, aligned with national cancer control strategies and KEMRI cancer registry reporting.

Customized patient profile for oncology care in Kenya. This profile is part of the Oncology Implementation Guide for Kenya (Oncology-IG-Kenya) — a draft version (0.1.0) dated 2025-06-18. It models key patient elements aligned with Kenya’s national cancer registry, SHA (Smart Health Authority), DHIS2, and local care workflows. This guide demonstrates how HL7® FHIR® can be applied to transform cancer care, from screening to palliative support. It is a proof-of-concept created independently by a Kenyan digital health enthusiast, with no official endorsement, to inspire innovation using open health standards and locally relevant data modeling.
Defines structured cancer registry reporting format for Kenya, integrating with KEMRI Cancer Registry, Nairobi Cancer Registry, and DHIS2.

A FHIR R4-based SupplyRequest profile for cancer-specific medical supplies in Kenya. Supports drug procurement, diagnostic supply needs, and inventory tracking aligned with Kenya’s National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Kenya Cancer Policy (2020–2030), and practical needs of facilities reporting to the KEMRI registry and SHA ecosystem.

A profile for prescribing cancer-related medications in Kenya. Aligned with the Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Cancer Policy (2020–2030), and reporting needs of KEMRI and county cancer registries. Supports chemotherapy, palliative care, and anti-cancer drugs with ICD-10 and Kenya EMR terminology support.
Observation profile for cancer-related data elements in Kenya's oncology care, supporting reporting, staging, diagnosis, and national registry alignment.

FHIR R4 profile for practitioners involved in oncology care in Kenya. Aligns with Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Kenya Cancer Policy (2020–2030), KEMRI Cancer Registry guidelines, and workforce tracking as emphasized in the KESHO and Nyandarua registry reports. Supports credentialing, role classification, and regional deployment for cancer care delivery.

FHIR R4 profile for defining roles of healthcare professionals involved in oncology services in Kenya. Supports assignment of oncology roles, facility affiliations, cancer services scope, and geographic deployment. Based on Kenya Cancer Policy (2020–2030), National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), KEMRI cancer registry requirements, and KESHO conference findings.

Procedure profile tailored for oncology use in Kenya, supporting documentation of diagnostic, surgical, medical, radiotherapy, and palliative interventions. Aligned with Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Cancer Policy (2020–2030), KEMRI registry practices, and county-level reporting, using ICD-10 as the sole terminology for reporting procedures and conditions.

Structured response to oncology-related questionnaires used in Kenyan cancer screening, diagnosis, treatment, palliative care, and national registry reporting workflows. Aligns with Kenya's National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Cancer Policy (2020–2030), KEMRI data elements, and county registry efforts.

A specialized ServiceRequest profile for oncology-related referrals, diagnostics, and procedures in Kenya. Informed by the Kenya National Cancer Control Strategy (2023–2027), Kenya Cancer Policy (2020–2030), and data practices from KEMRI and county cancer registries. Supports service ordering for biopsies, imaging, oncology specialist reviews, palliative care referrals, and tracking within a multidisciplinary care model.
Captures the highest level of formal education attained by a patient in Kenya. Supports cancer registry reporting, care planning, and socioeconomic assessment.
The current or most recent occupation of the patient.
